wikipedia_page.main: Charles Edward James "Charlie" Gunn (14 August 1885 – 30 December 1983) was a British athlete who competed mainly in the 10 kilometre walk. He competed for Great Britain in the 1920 Summer Olympics held in Antwerp, Belgium in the 10 kilometre walk where he won the bronze medal.He was born in St Pancras, London and died in Chichester.
